results.title: La Ronde
results.brief_description: An ironic narrator comperes Ophuls’ circular tale of love and seduction set in the nostalgic Vienna of 1900. “La Ronde” was booed at its premiere, but went on to become one of the greatest successes of post-war European cinema. Bans and protests againsts its ‘immorality’ only boosted its fame: in London it played for eighteen months at one cinema. With a superb cast, lavish production values and bravura camerawork, “La Ronde” confirms Ophuls’ reputation as one of the cinema’s major artists. Stars a veritable who’s who of European cinema including Anton Walbrook, Simone Signoret, Serge Reggiani, Simone Simon, Daniel Gelin, Danielle Darrieux, Fernand Gravey, Odette Joyeux, Jean-Louis Barrault, Isa Miranda and Gerard Philipe.

results.title: Don Giovanni
results.creator_credit: Joseph Losey, Michel Seydoux, Camera One and Gaumont-Opera
results.brief_description: Dame Kiri Te Kanawa and Ruggerio Raimondi star in Mozart’s opera “Don Giovanni”, inspired by the exploits of the womaniser Don Juan and set in the palaces and countryside surrounding Venice.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joseph Losey, Michel Seydoux, Camera One and Gaumont-Opera

results.title: Asya's Happiness
results.brief_description: Asya Klyashina is a cook in a small Russian village, lame and unmarried. During harvest time she works at a field camp where she renews acquaintance with Sasha, a driver returned from the city, who announces that he loves her but has no thought of marriage. Mothers look after their children amid the harvest; the men reminisce about the Patriotic War (“fighting for the Motherland, for Stalin”) and about the prison camps after the war. But complications to her life start when Asya discovers she is pregnant by another youth, Stephan.

results.title: The Sixth part of the world
results.brief_description: Dziga Vertov was the founder of the Soviet documentary. He headed a group of experimental documentarists who took the name Kinoki, or Kino- Eyes. As a militant theorist he proclaimed the supremacy of what would now be called Cinema-Verite. His films and his theoretical writings have had an enormous and lasting influence on world cinema. “The sixth part of the World” is Vertov’s lyrical cinema poem to the vast expanses of the Soviet Union, grand, complicated, exotic and hugely popular.

results.title: I hate your guts = The Intruder = The Informer
results.brief_description: After thirty commercial successes, Roger Corman here tackled the contemporary theme of racism and delivered an exemplary piece of tough-minded, hard-hitting low-budget filmmaking. William Shatner, exuding a sleazy but effective charm, plays a power-hungry demagogue who arrives in a small Southern town reluctantly facing up to desegregation. His impassioned speeches stir up the white community, revive the Ku Klux Klan and lead to attacks on black families and a near-lynching. Adapted from the novel by Charles Beaumont.

results.title: Alexander Nevsky
results.creator_credit: D Vasiliev, Sergei Eisenstein and Mosfilm
results.brief_description: Sergei Eisenstein’s patriotic masterpiece of the exploits of 13th Century Russian hero Prince Alexander Nevsky was his first sound film and featured a special musical score by composer Sergey Prokovief. The Prince, as chosen leader of the people of Novgorod, vanquished the Teutonic Knights on the ice of Lake Peipus. The characters, boldly drawn and unencumbered with psychological details, are monumental figures. All are conceived as they are imagined today and as they survive in folklore. The impressive cast includes Nikolai Cherkassov as Nevsky.

results.title: The New Adventures of Pippi Longstocking
results.creator_credit: Ken Annakin, Walter Moshay, Gary Mehlman and Columbia
results.brief_description: Based on the classic books by Astrid Lindgren, Pippi Longstocking bursts onto the screen in this all new live action motion picture. Loved the world over by young and old, Pippi Longstocking is a pigtailed, freckle faced ball of fun and energy. Mischievous, lovable and always in trouble, Pippi is a young orphan who refuses to let anything stand in her way. Full of colourful characters, fun and laughs “The new adventures of Pippi Longstocking” is a delightful adventure movie for the young and the young at heart.

results.title: Anne of Green Gables: The Sequel
results.brief_description: Multi-award winning “Anne of Green Gables: The Sequel” continues the charming story of Anne Shirley, now an attractive and high spirited 18 year old whose life is brimming with romantic dreams, comic mishaps and adventure that will delight the whole family. Based on three books by Lucy Maud Montgomery: “Anne of Avonlea”, “Anne of the Island” and “Anne of Windy Poplars”.

results.title: The Black Stallion Returns
results.creator_credit: Robert Dalva, Francis Ford Coppola, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Zoetrope Studios
results.brief_description: A youth named Alec and a fabled Arabian steed survived a shipwreck and became inseparable friends in The Black Stallion, the first of Walter Farley’s 16-book series to be made into a highly successful film. In the sequel The Black Stallion returns, the horse is reclaimed by its rightful owner, beginning an odyssey to North Africa and a culture alien to Alec. Through his persistence, Alec gains new insights into courage, perseverance and honour. This action-filled adventure tale joins the initial film as a timeless classic. Stars Kelly Reno and Ferdy Mayne

results.title: The Red pony
results.creator_credit: Lewis Milestone and Charles K Felman Group
results.brief_description: John Steinbeck’s classic is brought to life with an outstanding cast and a fine script. It is a tender, moving story about the conflict between a nine year old boy, his father and the family’s hired hand. A small red pony becomes the focal point of the complex human relationships at the ranch and is the catalyst for the boy’s growth into manhood. Starring Myrna Loy and Robert Mitchum.
